author: Bill Rehaume

review: Let me start by saying amazon is one of the BEST companies out there in my opinion. Their customer service is always top notch and the quality of most products is always very good. I don't know where that ball got dropped with this!  I ordered the firestick for an extra TV in my workout room and once I got it set up, it works great BUT it took me almost an hour to get the batteries into the remote...and you can't set up (or use) the firestick without the remote. The back of the remote is nearly impossible to get off, therefore preventing you from being able to get the batteries in. If this was just a fluke or "operator error" on my part I would have never considered giving this product a "one", but when I went online to see if anyone else had similar issues, there were hundreds/thousands of posts about the same issue. Knowing that this is an issue with so many people and not fixing it prior to selling more is just negligent. I was frustrated beyond words trying to get this open and was using scissors tinted and wedge it open...not smart but when you are frustrated, you just want to figure the task out.  I was able to get the remote open safely but someone is bound to be not so lucky and really hurt themselves.  Unfortunately there is not really a great alternative for this product out there if you want to watch amazon prime but consider yourself warned that you either have to be a "muscle fit body builder" to get the remote open or beyond patient. Good luck!
author: kristin

review: This is my 1st post ever. I have a Roku Stick, Chromecast (student deal), and got the Fire TV stick (Free with Sling TV) today.Setup was easy. But I switched off the TV and turned the TV back on, Fire TV wouldn't work. Called support and was trouble shooting for an hour. They were going to send in a replacement device.Cons:Stupid design - The power port is on the left-side. It blocks all the other HDMI ports. Roku & Chromecast are neat, the power port is in the rear. Why would someone keep the power port in the side?2) The power adapter is flat and wide. It blocks 2 of my power plug slots. Roku has an iPhone Style power adapter, sleek and tall, so that it doesn't block other plug points.I would definitely not recommend this stupid device, even if its free.

review: It works, it is easy to setup, even without external USB power and more than 30 feet away from router, it picked up signal, it is updated, it is connected to wireless... and it was awesome, it was all I have wanted,  it worked with true HD and true sound...Then I have configured the parental control, requiring a pin for purchases, and with strong feeling of security happily went away to help my wife setup a dinner table and bragged all about all those new cool features... and bam... in less than 5 minutes my 3 years old kid managed to rent a movie for $5.99What? How? It was locked... and amazingly in settings it was showing that it is locked.... ?!?!Well... we have watched a good movie. Kids are in bed now, And I am crying and printing return label... This awesome and wonderful gadget is going back home to Amazon, it is dangerous.
